title: Dangerous devil worshipper goes on the run after fleeing hospital
text:
A dangerous devil worshipper went on the run today after fleeing the hospital where he was being held for stabbing his cousin.

Mosa Abid, 22, was sentenced to an indefinite hospital order in June 2017 after pleaded guilty to killing his only friend Moamen Settar after vowing to do so in a rambling letter to Satan.

He made off from Homerton hospital at 11.40am and is described as tall, thin and wearing spectacles that are damaged on both sides.

Mosa Abid, 22, (seen in two different mugshots) was sentenced to an indefinite hospital order in June 2017 for killing his 'only friend', Moamen Settar

He is dressed in a dark suit and a black Puffa-style hooded jacket.

Members of the public are advised not to approach Abid, who has connections to the Wembley and Northolt areas.

Abid went to Mr Settar's home in Wembley north London, on October 15, 2017, and took a large knife from the kitchen before repeatedly stabbing him.

The victim's younger sisters, aged 9 and 15, heard screams from their brother's bedroom before Abid left the house laughing with the knife hidden behind his back.

Abid then went to his father's flat to change into a new shirt, before he was found sitting on a bench by police next morning, reported ITV.

When police raided his home they found documents and devil worship and the Illuminati, including the letter to Satan.

Anyone who may have seen him should call 999 quoting CAD 2866/oct10.
description: Mosa Abid, 22, was sentenced to an indefinite hospital order in June 2017 having pleaded guilty to manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility. He escaped from Homerton hospital.
